item.name: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
Alhambra
item.comment: Rating is for 4 or less players. Works well with just two. Playing with 5-6 players is just painful agony - rating 2.

item.name: Am Fuß des Kilimandscharo
item.comment: ... rating reflects playing with kids (which is also supposed to be the main target audience)

item.name: Anno Domini: Erfindungen
item.comment: Kirche und Staat, Frauen, Im Namen des Gesetzes

item.name: Arkadia
item.comment: Players have to be too careful about not setting other players up.

item.name: Asterix & Obelix: Die Lorbeeren des Caesar
Babuschka
item.comment: Players can always at least force a draw by keeping another players pawn captured.

item.name: Battue: Storm of the Horse Lords
Die Baumeister des Krimsutep
item.comment: some nice elements, but high luck factor.

item.name: Big City
item.comment: Beautiful components, but limited options and a huge 'draw-the-right-cards-and-win' factor.

item.name: Big Deal
item.comment: Draw the cash cards and win...

item.name: Boggle
item.comment: Owning both versions - Boggle and Big Boggle

item.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Game
Buy Low Sell High
item.comment: Rounds are far too short to really get some kind of influence or to change strategy when you know where the 'trend' is heading. Also tax cards are much too strong.

item.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
Candy Land
item.comment: ... rating when playing with little kids.

item.name: Carla Cat
item.comment: more fun if playing with kids....

item.name: Catan Histories: Settlers of America – Trails to Rails
Catch a Falling Star
item.comment: ... same game as Klickado - just with another theme

item.name: Cheeky Monkey
item.comment: ... new Gryphon Games version. Especially when playing with kids the Monkey is great.

item.name: Chicago Express
item.comment: Too unforgiving and too dependent on possible 'mistakes' of the other players. Once you fall behind you stay there.

item.name: Chimera
item.comment: I know this game from its prototype stage. Unfortunately the scoring system (still) might lead to a large amount of kingmaking in the last round(s) of the game which is too bad, since I like the rest of the game quite a bit.

item.name: Chip-Chip Hurra
item.comment: Rating would be slightly higher rating it as a kids game only.

item.name: The Circle
item.comment:
As much as I wanted to like the game I have to agree with most of the 'negative comments' that are already up:
There's almost no incentive to activate a spy for two secrets. Why should I 'bring in' a new spy while lowering my chances to get him - even if I'm ahead the other players easily catch up until he's up for grabs.
King making was also an big issue in our game.

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
Coup
item.comment: .... especially with the forced coups this is king making par excellence (although I've to admit that this is the case in most of the 'take that' games, but here it is in its 'purest' form which is very annoying.

item.name: Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod: Das große Spiel
Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
Disney Pixar Cars 2 Sorry Sliders: World Grand Prix Race Edition
Disposition
item.comment: Considering its age this game was way ahead of its time. However a few rules problems prevent it from being a really good game (e.g. allowance of blocking target spaces can result in some king making effects). But this problems can easily be solved.

item.name: Don Quixote
item.comment: Agreed this one is 'multiplayer-solitaire', but this doesn't mean it bad at all. If you don't like 'multiplayer-solitaire' then don't play it (same reason I usually avoid abstract games - which doesn't make them bad either...), but if you like games like e.g. then this is worth playing.

item.name: The Downfall of Pompeii
item.comment: Two games in one (placing people, running away) - both work, but neither one is interesting or tense. Boring.

item.name: Drachenlachen
item.comment: Rating +1 if rated as a kids game.

item.name: Duck Duck Boom
item.comment: Rating might be bit higher then it should be, but the production looks really like a 'labour of love' and therefore IMHO it deserves a higher rating.

item.name: Duckomenta Memo
item.comment: Rating refers to playing with kids.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Temple of Elemental Evil Board Game
Egalité
item.comment: Nice idea - but can be a little bit too static for my tastes.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Eureka
item.comment: ... rating as a family game with kids

item.name: Felix: The Cat in the Sack
Fette Fünfzehn
item.comment: Another Wizard-type game nobody really needs...

item.name: Formidable Foes
item.comment: Once you fall behind you've got no chance of catching up. From that point it's just agony...

item.name: Fruit Fair
item.comment: Played the 'pre-production' edition at the Essen fair. Easy to get into, interesting choices and very balanced (even when you think you're behind you usually have the chance for a 'comeback'). Everybody at the table enjoyed it very much.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
The Game: Spiel...so lange du kannst!
Glen More
item.comment: Rating goes down to 5 with 5 players.

item.name: Go Away Monster!
item.comment: Rating as a kids game (with kids age 2.5)

item.name: Der Goldene Kompass: Duell der Panzerbären
GOSU
item.comment: Rating only for the two player game. Might be too long with more than two.

item.name: Greentown
item.comment: Game is 'above average', but IMHO has some 'endgame problems', therfore the low rating.

item.name: Ham-N-Ex
item.comment: ... not much of a game here, but the components are quite weird.

item.name: The Hanging Gardens
item.comment: I like this game, only downside (at least for me) is that in the 4-player game the player who goes last in the first round will be one time less starting player than all the other players which is imho quite a disadvantage (and it could have been easily corrected simply by adding 4 more cards....)

item.name: Heartland
item.comment:
Didn't really work with 5 players. Adding to the 'big fields' (if a player was able to) was far more attractive then advancing on the 'barn-track'. (In fact I wasn't able to add and it turned out that the 12-15 points you might get in the end don't make up for the 20 something points scored in a single turn for the big fields that showed up).
Also too few tiles for five players to make a 'long term strategy' worthwile.
Upgraded to '5' after playing with 3. Playing with fewer people adds a bit more control, but still nothing special.

item.name: Hercules: The Legendary Journeys Trading Card Game
Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
Der Herr der Ringe: Die Gefährten – Das Kartenspiel
Der Herr der Ringe: Die Rückkehr des Königs
Der Hobbit: Eine unerwartete Reise – Das Spiel zum Film
In the Year of the Dragon
Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
James Bond 007: Das Agentenspiel
item.comment: ... some nice elements, but the action cards are quite unbalanced.

item.name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
Jungle Mix: The Lion King
item.comment: ... rating when playing with kids of the lower end of the age suggestion (4-8)

item.name: Jurassic Park III Island Survival Game
Die Kette von Saba
item.comment: Much better to play the variant without the wild cards - otherwise too luck dependent.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
König Artus Tafelrunde
item.comment: Not bad, but once you fall behind you're doomed...

item.name: König und Konsorten
item.comment: Nothing new - Uno meets Fluxx meets the German 'Mau Mau', but with completely unbalanced law cards.

item.name: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider – The Angel of Darkness
League of Six
item.comment: Some interesting ideas, but playing 6 turns without any significant changes is quite repetitive. No tension is build up towards the end.

item.name: Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn
The Little Prince: Make Me a Planet
La Loire
item.comment:
I really wanted to like the game more than I actually did....
Due to the long playing time the game outstayed its welcome a bit. Also with the 'horse travel mechanic' you can easily get stuck in situation where you do just 'a bit more than nothing' each turn.

item.name: Looting London
item.comment:
Typical 'abstract Knizia' concerning the connection between the theme and gameplay, but pretty good IMHO.
Guess the rating would go down with more players as you'll have less control. We played 2 and 3 players, where 2 players seemed to be a bit more enjoyable.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – A Journey to Rhosgobel
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Across the Ettenmoors
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Assault on Osgiliath
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Celebrimbor's Secret
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Conflict at the Carrock
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Encounter at Amon Dîn
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Escape from Mount Gram
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Fog on the Barrow-downs
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Foundations of Stone
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Heirs of Númenor
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Khazad-dûm
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Escape from Dol Guldur
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Journey Along the Anduin
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Passage Through Mirkwood
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Return to Mirkwood
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Road to Rivendell
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Shadow and Flame
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Antlered Crown
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Battle of Carn Dûm
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Battle of Lake-town
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Black Riders
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Drúadan Forest
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Dunland Trap
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hills of Emyn Muil
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hobbit: On the Doorstep
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hobbit: Over Hill and Under Hill
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hunt for Gollum
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Long Dark
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Lost Realm
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Massing at Osgiliath
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Morgul Vale
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Nîn-in-Eilph
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Old Forest
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Redhorn Gate
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Road Darkens
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Steward's Fear
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Stone of Erech
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Three Trials
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Treachery of Rhudaur
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Treason of Saruman
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Voice of Isengard
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Wastes of Eriador
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Watcher in the Water
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Trouble in Tharbad
Lord of the Rings: The Search
The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game
Lost Legends
item.comment: Had pretty high hopes for this one since it has a lot of elements I usually like (card drafting, character 'development', slaying monsters etc.), but the game suffers of the 'rich get richer' syndrome paired with (more or less) player elimination (well you're still in the game, but without any chance of winning) if you've a bad combat round.

item.name: Magors Lesezauber
item.comment: ... rating when playing with the 'target age group' 5-9

item.name: Mall World
item.comment: Too many "abrupt" endings, too much downtime in comparison to the control you really have. Also because at least one special contract is removed certain colours get a definite advantage as less players are "competing" for these businesses. Apart from that graphics and colours are "not the best".

item.name: Los Mampfos
item.comment: ... rating as a kids game (but also fun for adults :)

item.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
item.comment:
Looking for the following AvX cards/dice:
Rare:
Black Widow - Killer Instinct Deadpool - Chiyonosake Doctor Octopus - Mad Scientist Green Goblin - Norman Osborn Loki - Grim-Keeper Mystique - Could be Anyone Nova - The Human Rocket Thing - Idol of Millions Vibranium Shield - Cap's Protection
Super Rare:
Mr. Fantastic - Elastic Wolverine - Canucklehead
Have the following for trade:
Uncommon:
Hawkeye - Br'er Hawkeye Phoenix - Redd Punisher - Vigilante Loki - Illusionist Nick Fury - WW II Veteran Rogue - Anna Marie Thing - Grim Ben Professor X - Powerful Telepath
Rare:
Angel - Soaring Doctor Doom - Victor Magneto - Sonderkommando Night Crawler - Circus Freak Phoenix - Jeannie Professor X - Charles Francis Xavier Silver Surfer - Sky Rider War Machine - James Rhodes
Will also trade for boardgames - just have a look at my 'for trade' list!

item.name: The Master of the Merchant in the Sakai
Mein Mäuschen-Farbspiel
item.comment: Rating refers to playing with kids.

item.name: Mensch ärgere dich nicht: Das Knobelspiel
Mia and me: Rettet die Einhörner!
Mini Skip-Bo Express
item.comment: ... rating is for playing with kids

item.name: Mmm!
item.comment: a bit too easy, but great when playing with kids

item.name: Oregon
item.comment: OK, luck factor is huge, but still enough decisions to keep you interested. Also a game you can play with gamers and non-gamers.

item.name: Paparazzi
item.comment: Some nice deduction elements, but certain rules combined with die rolling make it too luck dependent for my taste.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – The Hook Mountain Massacre Adventure Deck 3
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – The Skinsaw Murders Adventure Deck 2
Patrician
item.comment: Occasionally some king making issues in the end. Also the lack of a chance to pick up certain 'key cards' in some situations might be pretty frustrating.

item.name: Pickomino
item.comment: it's 'only' 'Can't stop meets Yahtzee' die rolling with some twists, but it's fun!

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth: Builders Duel
Pirate Plank
item.comment: Rating of 7 is mainly for playing with kids. Adults only maybe a 6.

item.name: The Prestel New York Architecture Game
item.comment: Slight flaw as players can hold the final tiles to prevent other players from scoring (or ending the game) when they have no chance of winning themselves. Game will go on forever then...

item.name: The Prince: The Struggle of House Borgia
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Railways of the World: The Card Game
Risk: The Lord of the Rings Trilogy Edition
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Runebound (Second Edition)
item.comment: Although I like the game it can be 2-3 hours of agony for a player who falls behind early.

item.name: Saqqara
item.comment: I can see that the game with 5 players might be as painful as described in other reviews/comments, but with only 3 players it's a decent game.

item.name: Die Säulen der Erde: das Kartenspiel
Scary Tales: Snow White vs. The Giant
Schnappt Hubi!
item.comment: Rating as a kids game and based on the reaction of my kids. Although it's fun for adults, too.

item.name: Scripts and Scribes: The Dice Game
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Rook City
Sequenz
item.comment: Too static to achieve a winning position against an equally strong opponent.

item.name: The Settlers of Zarahemla
item.comment: Rating should be higher, but the game is mainly the Settlers 'Cheops' scenario/variant sold as a completely new (settlers-)game.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Die Siedler von Catan: Historische Szenarien
Smash Up: Science Fiction Double Feature
Snorta!
item.comment: ...great fun with the right crowd of people.

item.name: Sole Mio!
item.comment: More complicated than Mamma Mia but less predictable as the 'helping-option' ruins every knowledge of the cards played.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
SPANC: Space Pirate Amazon Ninja Catgirls
Spectrangle
item.comment: Luck of the tile draws outweighs every other strategy. What can you do if your 'average tile number' is 2.5 while your opponents is greater 3.5?

item.name: Star Trek: Customizable Card Game (first edition)
Star Wars: Bounty Hunter – Das Würfelspiel
Star Wars: Death Star Assault Game
The Stars Are Right
item.comment: Some neat ideas, but welcome to downtime heaven....

item.name: Symbioz
item.comment: Only 'works' if players 'attack' each other more or less equally.

item.name: Tal der Abenteuer: Die Schatzsuche im Himalaja
Tales & Games: The Hare & the Tortoise
Tante Trudels Trödel
item.comment: ... rating higher when playing with kids.

item.name: Tara, Seat of Kings
item.comment: .... I really wanted to like this one, but though the mechanics are decent it takes definitely too long (if it ends at all....)

item.name: The Three Musketeers: The Queen's Pendants
Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Thunderstone
item.comment: Dropped from 9 to 8 as some of the village cards are too useless to purchase in any setup.

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 1 – Team Asia & Legendary Asia
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 2 – India & Switzerland
item.comment: Rating should be (much!) lower for re-releasing Switzerland with this map just to affront the Ticket to Ride fans who already own it (and thus paying far too much for a single map...), but I decided to rate the 'game only'.

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 3 – The Heart of Africa
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 4 – Nederland
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 5 – United Kingdom & Pennsylvania
Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
To Court the King
item.comment: Some characters are far better than others so it's usually not worth taking them (e.g. why take a 20+ character to reroll when you can get a 'cheaper' character to add a die (and then reroll...) which limits different strategies quite a bit, but still a lot of fun.

item.name: Toledo
item.comment: Rating upgraded after giving the game a 2nd chance...

item.name: Die Tore der Welt: Das Kartenspiel
Trampelpfad
item.comment: ... rating based on playing with adults. Rating with kids - 7

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: Bild Edition [German]
item.comment: I generally enjoy quiz-games, although this is "just" Trivial Pursuit

item.name: Tschakka Lakka: Die rasante Würfeljagd nach dem Tempelschatz
Ubongo: Star Wars – Das Erwachen der Macht
Vampire Hunter
item.comment: Rating includes a bonus for the really cool day/night mechanism of the game.

item.name: Vermögensbildung
item.comment: not bad for a game of its age...

item.name: Voll in Fahrt
item.comment: Rating mainly as a kids game, but also for adults playing along with them.

item.name: Walk the Dogs
item.comment: ... rating when playing with kids, but also fun for adults.

item.name: Warhammer Quest: The Adventure Card Game
Wars of the Roses: Lancaster vs. York
Was ist Was: Junior – Baustelle Kartenspiel
Wicked Witches Way
item.comment: In the category of speed games this is one of the best ones!

item.name: The Witcher: The Adventure Card Game
Würfel Bingo
item.comment: A little bit like 'Take it easy' with dice ... may not be a big new invention, but I like it :)

item.name: XIG: The Four Elements
item.comment: Wanted to like this one, but the special cards have far too much influence on the game and are too unbalanced.

item.name: Yedo
item.comment: ... mmmh, generally this is 'my kind of game', but especially the absolutely unbalanced action cards pretty much ruin it IMHO. I can live with different 'grades of usefulness', but there shouldn't be cards that can ruin the whole game for another player (which aren't even part of the Samurai cards). E.g. last game I had a card to 'trade' a mission with a player who only had one black and one yellow mission left and was trying to get the 'components' for the black one. I could trade him another black mission which I wasn't able to complete and which the other player would never be able to fulfil since he was missing a necessary building. Since it was two rounds to the end the other player would never be able to recover...This would be OK for a 30 min 'Take That'-game, but not in a two hour and up 'heavy' game.

item.name: Yetisburg: Titanic Battles in History, Vol. 1
Zanzibar
item.comment: Well, 'it works', but it lacks any fun. For such a small game it has way to much downtime and there's nothing you can do when it's not your turn.

item.name: ZwergeZocken
item.comment: Game is quite good, but the companies customer support is bad bad bad... My first copy was missing a card... I wrote to them - but all I got was the answer that they don't have any cards available, but they will try to find one - that was half a year and several emails ago.
